info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 3:25PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Fairfield and northwestern New Haven Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 324 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Southbury, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Waterbury, Meriden, Wallingford, Naugatuck, Southbury, Wolcott, Newtown, Cheshire, Monroe, Brookfield, Prospect, Middlebury, Beacon Falls, Bethany and Oxford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
